Metadata.Name: Subpoena
Metadata.Summary: The Subpoena IEPD was developed for the California Department of Justice - Data Exchange Project.
Metadata.Description: A Subpoena is a command to appear before a designated court on a particular date and time as a witness in a criminal action prosecuted by The People of The State of California. A subpeona is sent from the Prosecutor and/or Public Defender to a Law Enforcement Agency and/or Sheriff's Department. The Subpoenat contains court information such as court location, date, time, and signature block. The Subpoena is one of 44 IEPDs developed by California Department of Justice - Data Exchange Project to support information exchange between state and local government organizations throughout the state of California. It could also be adapted for use in other states.
Metadata.Status: IEPD Subpoena complete and ready for implementation
Metadata.ExchangePartners: California state and local criminal justice agencies
Metadata.Process: The Subpoena is sent to a Law Enforcement Agency and/or Sheriff's Department by the Prosecutor and/or Public Defender to notify of a subject's court appearance and requirement for an Officer to appear in court.
Metadata.Conditions: If the court schedules a first appearance, a subsequent appearance, and/or requires the Officer to appear in court to testify, then the Subpoena is sent to the Law Enforcement Agency and/or Sheriff's Department.
Metadata.Sponsors: California Department of Justice and other California state and local criminal justice agencies - see master documentation
Metadata.Purpose: Notifies a Law Enforcement Agency and/or Sheriff's Department if a subject is scheduled for a first appearance or subsequent appearance in court and may notify that an Officer's testimony is required.
Metadata.ExchangePartnerCategories: California state and local criminal justice agencies
